body:
Please make sure you are using the correct TF version. 
The classification code has been tested with Python 2.7.12, TensorFlow 1.2.1, CUDA 8.0 and cuDNN 5.1.1 on Ubuntu 16.04.

I use tensorflow 1.4.0.
So how to run the code on tensorflow 1.4.0 then .......

problem solved.
Thanks to Pointnet++ project. I find the way to fix the problem in READE.md in Pointnet++.
If you are using TF 1.4.0 or above ,simply replace the g++ commands in makefile to  
the following sentence:
g++ -std=c++11 tf_xxxx.cpp tf_xxxx_g.cu.o -o tf_xxxx_so.so -shared -fPIC -I /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/include -I /usr/local/cuda-8.0/include -I /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/include/external/nsync/public -lcudart -L /usr/local/cuda-8.0/lib64/ -L/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow -ltensorflow_framework -O2 -D_GLIBCXX_USE_CXX11_ABI=0
where xxxx represents approxmatch or nndistance.
I close the issue,thanks.

> problem solved.
> Thanks to Pointnet++ project. I find the way to fix the problem in READE.md in Pointnet++.
> If you are using TF 1.4.0 or above ,simply replace the g++ commands in makefile to
> the following sentence:
> g++ -std=c++11 tf_xxxx.cpp tf_xxxx_g.cu.o -o tf_xxxx_so.so -shared -fPIC -I /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/include -I /usr/local/cuda-8.0/include -I /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/include/external/nsync/public -lcudart -L /usr/local/cuda-8.0/lib64/ -L/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow -ltensorflow_framework -O2 -D_GLIBCXX_USE_CXX11_ABI=0
> where xxxx represents approxmatch or nndistance.
> I close the issue,thanks.

Hello there! I followed your method and the result still shows the same error

Dear @skq-5233 ,
I updated the installation instructions for a more recent environment spec (TensorFlow 1.13.2, CUDA 10.0 and cuDNN 7.6.2). I highly recommend to use this environment spec instead of TensorFlow 1.4.0.

Thank you for your reply, I have solved it.


------------------ 原始邮件 ------------------
发件人: "Itai Lang"<notifications@github.com>;
发送时间: 2020年6月28日(星期天) 晚上7:32
收件人: "orendv/learning_to_sample"<learning_to_sample@noreply.github.com>;
抄送: "Dandelion's Fled"<794919561@qq.com>;"Mention"<mention@noreply.github.com>;
主题: Re: [orendv/learning_to_sample] tensorflow.python.framework.errors_impl.NotFoundError: /home/robot/learning_to_sample/classification/structural_losses/tf_nndistance_so.so: undefined symbol: _ZTIN10tensorflow8OpKernelE (#3)





 
Dear @skq-5233 ,
 I updated the installation instructions for a more recent environment spec (TensorFlow 1.13.2, CUDA 10.0 and cuDNN 7.6.2). I highly recommend to use this environment spec instead of TensorFlow 1.4.0.
 
—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or unsubscribe.
Great! Can you please share your solution?
How to get around this error when using a conda environment?

@cpayal,
Please run the installation instructions from within the conda environment (after it is activated).

I also ran into a very similar problem :tensorflow.python.framework.errors_impl.NotFoundError: /home/wzm/CodeSet/SNET/classification/structural_losses/tf_approxmatch_so.so: undefined symbol: _ZN10tensorflow12OpDefBuilder5InputESs

I use tf=1.13 python=2.7 cuda=10.0 as suggested by @itailang , but the problem remains.


I solved it with @skq-5233 's method.
By the way,
that is not a 'ABI' variable.
It is actually 'D_GLIBCXX_USE_CXX11_ABI'.

Deleting this variable in two .sh files makes everything works well.

@wzm2256,
Thank you for sharing the solution!

delete " -D_GLIBCXX_USE_CXX11_ABI=0". There are two in my codes!
I only delete one and I meet this issue. Find out if there are other commands!

Dear @Iam-Jane,
Thank you for your comment. I fixed the compilation commands.

My solution to this problem is as follows. Hope it can help other people.
```
nvcc = /usr/local/cuda-10.0/bin/nvcc
cudalib = /usr/local/cuda-10.0/lib64/
tensorflow = /databank/home/lihanxing/anaconda3/envs/att/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/include/

all: tf_approxmatch_so.so tf_approxmatch_g.cu.o tf_nndistance_so.so tf_nndistance_g.cu.o


tf_approxmatch_so.so: tf_approxmatch_g.cu.o tf_approxmatch.cpp
	g++ -std=c++11 tf_approxmatch.cpp tf_approxmatch_g.cu.o -o tf_approxmatch_so.so -shared -fPIC -I $(tensorflow) -lcudart -L $(cudalib) -O2 -D_GLIBCXX_USE_CXX11_ABI=0 -I $TF_INC -I /databank/home/lihanxing/anaconda3/envs/att/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/include/external/nsync/public -L $TF_LIB -L /databank/home/lihanxing/anaconda3/envs/att/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/ -ltensorflow_framework


tf_approxmatch_g.cu.o: tf_approxmatch_g.cu
	$(nvcc) -D_GLIBCXX_USE_CXX11_ABI=0 -std=c++11 -c -o tf_approxmatch_g.cu.o tf_approxmatch_g.cu -I $(tensorflow) -DGOOGLE_CUDA=1 -x cu -Xcompiler -fPIC -O2 -I $TF_INC -I$TF_INC/external/nsync/public -L$TF_LIB -ltensorflow_framework


tf_nndistance_so.so: tf_nndistance_g.cu.o tf_nndistance.cpp
	g++ -std=c++11 tf_nndistance.cpp tf_nndistance_g.cu.o -o tf_nndistance_so.so -shared -fPIC -I $(tensorflow) -lcudart -L $(cudalib) -O2 -D_GLIBCXX_USE_CXX11_ABI=0 -I $TF_INC -I /databank/home/lihanxing/anaconda3/envs/att/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/include/external/nsync/public -L $TF_LIB -L /databank/home/lihanxing/anaconda3/envs/att/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/ -ltensorflow_framework


# /usr/local/cuda-10.0/bin/nvcc -std=c++11 -c -o tf_nndistance_g.cu.o tf_nndistance_g.cu -I $TF_INC -DGOOGLE_CUDA=1 -x cu -Xcompiler -fPIC -O2
# g++ -std=c++11 tf_nndistance.cpp tf_nndistance_g.cu.o -o tf_nndistance_so.so -shared -fPIC -I $TF_INC -I /usr/local/cuda-10.0/include -I $TF_INC/external/nsync/public -lcudart -L /usr/local/cuda-10.0/lib64/ -L$TF_LIB -ltensorflow_framework -O2 -D_GLIBCXX_USE_CXX11_ABI=0


tf_nndistance_g.cu.o: tf_nndistance_g.cu
	$(nvcc) -D_GLIBCXX_USE_CXX11_ABI=0 -std=c++11 -c -o tf_nndistance_g.cu.o tf_nndistance_g.cu -I $(tensorflow) -DGOOGLE_CUDA=1 -x cu -Xcompiler -fPIC -O2 -I $TF_INC -I$TF_INC/external/nsync/public -L$TF_LIB -ltensorflow_framework

clean:
	rm tf_approxmatch_so.so
	rm tf_nndistance_so.so
	rm  *.cu.o 
```
